intro: Trigonella uncata, commonly known as the slender fenugreek, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its seeds are small and oval, often used in traditional medicine for their potential health benefits. Trigonella uncata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks.
